questions.question: It is given that $a$ and $b$ are the roots of the quadratic equation $x^2 - 2x - 10 = 0$ and that $a > b$. Show that $a^3 - 2b = 2$.
A circle with centre $O$ passes through the points $P(-1, 7)$ and $Q(0, 8)$. (a) State the relationship between the perpendicular bisector of $PQ$ and the point $O$.
Find the coordinates of $O$, given that the line $y = 2x - 2$ passes through the centre of the circle.
Hence find the equation of the circle.
The polynomial $f(x)$ is given by $f(x) = x^3 - 9x^2 - 30x - 23$. (a) Factorise $f(x)$ completely.
questions.category: Polynomials, cubic equations and partial fractions

questions.question: Hence, prove that the equation $x^3 - 9x^2 - 30x - 23 = 0$ has only one real root. Find the solution.
questions.category: Polynomials, cubic equations and partial fractions

questions.question: Solve the equation \( 12x^2 + 23x - 5 = 0 \).
The equation of a curve is \( y = 2x^2 - ax + b \) where \( a \) and \( b \) are non-zero constants. Explain why \( y > 0 \) if \( 2a > b \).
Find an expression for \( x \), in terms of \( e \), for which \( \ln(x - 3) = \ln(x + 3) \).
Solve the equation \( \log_5(x) + \log_5(x + 4) = 2 \).
Prove the trigonometric identity: \( \frac{\csc A + 2\cot A}{\cos A + \sin A} = \csc A \).
Hence solve the equation: \( \csc^2 A + 2\cot A = 4(\cos A + \sin A) \) for \( 0 \leq x \leq 360^\circ \).
Given that \( 1 + \sin x + 2\cos x = 1 + 2\sin x + \cos x \) and \( x \) is acute, find the exact value of \( \cos x \).
Write down the first four terms in the expansion of \( (1 - 4x)^6 \).
Hence find the coefficient of \( x^3 \) in the expansion of \( (2x + 3)(1 - 4x)^6 \).
Explain why there is no constant term in the expansion of \( \left( 12x + \frac{3}{x^3} \right)^{18} \).

A solid was heated and left to cool in a container in a room. The difference between its temperature and the surrounding room temperature at time \( t \) hours was \( T \degree C \). The table shows some recorded values of \( t \) and \( T \). \[ \begin{array}{c|ccccc} t \text{ (hours)} & 5 & 10 & 15 & 22 & 25 \\ \hline T \text{ (} \degree C \text{)} & 15.1 & 8.4 & 5.2 & 2.7 & 1.6 \end{array} \] The variables \( t \) and \( T \) are related by the equation \( T = ae^{bt} \), where \( a \) and \( b \) are constants.
On the grid opposite, draw a straight line graph of \( \ln T \) against \( t \).
Use your graph to estimate the value of \( a \) and of \( b \).
With reference to (a), explain why the value of \( T \) cannot be zero.
